metadata.name: Desert Bighorn Sheep
metadata.description:
I saw the beasts that prowl the dunes,  
The serpents that coil in the heat,  
The lizards that dart through the dust,  
And I was filled with wonder.

I heard of the great sandstorm,  
That can bury a man alive,  
And of the wandering oasis,  
That is the only refuge from the heat.

For the first time, I saw life  
All around me in the sand;  
The scaly, the clawed, the fanged,  
All working together to survive.

And in that moment, I understood  
Why they call it the land of the dead;  
For in the desert, life is a battle,  
And only the strong survive.
